sense.name: sanction or approve something
sense.examples: The film star did not authorize this biography of her life. The principal couldn't authorize that sort of behavior at school.

sense.name: empower or delegate authority to someone
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] AUTHORIZE NP2[patient[human] PP[attribute] NP1[agent] AUTHORIZE NP2[patient[human] [goal]
sense.examples: She authorized John to sign checks for our club. Can you authorize anyone you choose to carry out your written will? They have authorized Congress to investigate this.
